channel.title: Creating, Promoting, and Deleting Accounts At School!
channel.description:
This tutorial will show you how you can create, promote, or delete and account at school. I take NO responsibility for what you do with this information, so don't blame it on me if you fuck up and get caught :P
[b]Creating An Account[/b]
[ul][li]Open up your Command Prompt, If you dont have one and want to learn how, go [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,4092.0.html]Here![/url][/li] [li]Type [/li][/ul] [code]net user usernamehere /add[/code] *Note, you can put a password on it if you would like, simply type in the password after the username.
[ul][li]The usernamehere is where your username goes ;) so you can put whatever you want in there, if you do it successfuly, then you should get "the command completed successfuly"[/li][/ul]
[b]Figuring Out The Local Group's[/b]
[ul][li]Now type [/li][/ul] [code]net localgroup[/code]
[ul][li]A bunch of things will pop up like, Administrators, Guests, etc.[/li] [li]Choose out of those which you would like your account to be (I'd go with the all-mighty Admin :p)[/li][/ul]
[b]Promoting An Account[/b]
[ul][li]You MUST HAVE an account already created to promote it![/li] [li]Type [/li][/ul] [code]net localgroup groupnamehere usernamehere /add[/code] *Example | [code]net localgroup Administrators Omfgurweird /add[/code] [ul][li]Note, you HAVE TO type the groupname exactly how it appears on the screen for localgroups, the only thing you can be lazy about is that you dont have to capitalize the first letter.[/li][/ul]
[b]Deleting An Account[/b]
[ul][li]This is the exact same thing as in creating an account, but at the end, instead of typing /add, replace it with /delete :rolleyes:[/li][/ul]
[url=http://img414.imageshack.us/my.php?image=createadmin7zs.swf&width=800]Watch The Video Here![/url] ^^Another video I created for all you visual learner's :D
Like my tutorials? Gimme feedback :P

item.title: Creating, Promoting, and Deleting Accounts At School!
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

At my school you can open a .bat , the only way i could get one to open at first was to save it to a flash disk and run it from that, but eventually i found out that i could save it in my documents (obviously if an admin see’s it im boned).

I couldn’t create/delete user accounts or much, i could get into regedit but everything was locked as it said i do not have enough privelages or what not.

The only fun thing i can do out of this is run a .bat that makes the screen flash different colours. Does anyone else have anything i can try running that is fun like that?

Read full topic

item.title: Creating, Promoting, and Deleting Accounts At School!
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:2, topic:3470”]Nice guide man.

Don’t forget how to totally screw up the computer…

delete *.*

That deletes the whole harddrive.

Also go into any kind of program like Paint, Microsoft word, microsoft excel, or something and press Ctrl + O. That gets you to see all the files in case you can’t see them because your computer manager has shutoff right click, the start menu, double clicking on my computer, and a lot of other restrictions like at our school. So once you press Ctrl + O. Make it say at the bottom, All files so you can see them all. If you need to edit something to mess it up (since your comp probably won’t let you delete) just right click on it, and click edit, open, or open-with. Just don’t press select or it will try to open it in paint or microsoft word or something lol. Might show up in wierd characters.

~Ron[/quote]

This will only work if the school haven’t locked down the computers. At our school they have “removed” access to the C:\ drive (I say “removed” because the subst f: c:\ command maps it to the f: drive so I can access it anyway)

Read full topic
item.source: Creating, Promoting, and Deleting Accounts At School!

He does not lie.
